notes: Full-size sedan on Ford Panther platform (1992-2011). Shared with Ford Crown Victoria. Fleet favorite. Modular V8 engine. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Grand Marquis article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation midsize sedan (1996-2005). Ford Taurus twin. DN5 platform. Wagon discontinued 1999. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Sable article, January 2025 revision.
Eighth generation sports coupe (1999-2002). Based on Ford Mondeo/Contour platform. Replaced by Marauder concept. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Cougar article, January 2025 revision.
First generation midsize SUV (1997-2010). Ford Explorer twin. UN105/UN150 platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Mountaineer article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Mazda 323/Familia convertible (1991-1994). Built by Mazda in Australia. Turbo XR2 variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Capri article, January 2025 revision.
Rebadged Nissan Quest (1993-2002). Joint venture with Nissan. Built in Ohio. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Villager article, January 2025 revision.
Compact sedan (1995-2000). Ford Contour twin. CDW27 platform (Mondeo). Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Mystique article, January 2025 revision.
Fourth generation compact (1997-1999). Ford Escort twin. Replaced by Focus-based models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mercury Tracer article, January 2025 revision.
